author: UAB Athletics Media Relations
title: men's hoops to have seven games televised on ASN
text:
The UAB men's basketball team will be the most televised team in the league in 2015-16 after Thursday's announcement from Conference USA that seven more Blazer Basketball games have been selected for TV by the American Sports Network (ASN).
"We are thrilled to be the most televised team in the league," head coach Jerod Haase said. "We again are excited to continue adding national exposure to our program and look forward to showcasing our program this season."
With the previous announcement of eight UAB games on the CBS Sports Network and Fox Sports, the Blazers' total of televised games in 2015-16 comes to 15, the most in the league.
ASN, in partnership with C-USA, chose six UAB home games for national TV, including two league matchups. In all, nine of the Blazers' 16 (regular season) home contests will appear on national television across various networks.
ASN will televise UAB's matchups versus Alabama State (Nov. 16), Jacksonville State (Nov. 22), Georgia State (Dec. 1), Stephen F. Austin (Dec. 29), Middle Tennessee (Jan. 3), FIU (Feb. 4), and at Florida Atlantic (March 5).
In addition to the ASN games, UAB will also appear on CBS Sports Network five times (Jan. 9 vs. UTEP, Jan. 14 at Old Dominion, Jan. 21 vs. Rice, Jan. 30 at Marshall, Feb. 20 at Middle Tennessee), and the FOX Sports family of networks for three games (Jan. 28 at WKU, Feb. 13 at Louisiana Tech, Feb. 27 vs. WKU).
Season tickets for UAB's 17 home games are on sale for $215 to the general public and $195 to UAB employees and active members of the National Alumni Society. A limited number of Family Section seats remain at $75 each. For more information and to place your order, call the UAB Ticket Office (205-975-UAB1 or 205-975-8221) or log on at uabsports.com.
The Blazers and the City of Birmingham will serve as host to the Conference USA Tournament for the second year in a row, March 8-12, at the Legacy Arena. Tickets for the conference tournament are priced at $250 for Premium seats, $180 for mid-court, $100 for Baseline.
ASN is an initiative of the Sinclair Networks Group, LLC, which owns and operates, programs and provides sales services to 164 television stations in 79 markets, reaching approximately 43 million U.S. television households. It includes FOX, ABC, CBS, MyTV, CW, NBC, Univision and Azteca affiliates. ASN, which launched in August 2014, produced 250 college events in nine sports in its first year and plans to air more than 375 events in the 2015-16 academic year.
